fields.description:
As a user I want to be able to type an issuekey (e.g. XXX-1234) in NIN's search text field and have that issue show up in the list, so that I can easily find issues in the text search if I remember the issuekey number.

The *text*, fuzzy search operator should include issuekey field in addition to the fields it already included.

Refer to feedback here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-76149
fields.summary: Add issuekey to *text* search JQL parameter to allow search for issuekey in NIN/GIN text search field

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users were able to remove issues from completed sprints via bulk change.
Right now, the bulk change action no longer remove completed sprints from issues.

Atlassian Community post: [How do I remove an issue from a completed sprint?|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/How-do-I-remove-an-issue-from-a-completed-sprint/qaq-p/123077]

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Have an issue associated to a completed sprint.
# Open the JIRA issue search.
# Search for this issue.
# Perform a bulk change.
# Select *Change Sprint Field* and leave the sprint field value empty.
# The bulk change will remove future and active sprints from the issue, but not the completed issues.

h3. Expected Result

The bulk change sprint field action will clear the sprint field value (including completed sprints).

h3. Actual Result
The bulk change sprint field action will remove active and future sprints but keep completed sprints.
fields.summary: Bulk change no longer clear the sprint field value containing completed sprints.

fields.description:
Currently there are few search options within Jira as described under https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/search-for-issues-in-jira/

The search box in the main Jira search - checks for typed text in issue key as well as summary and content 
 !image-2021-03-11-13-00-38-423.png|thumbnail! 

The search box directly under a board is searching based on issue key
 !image-2021-03-11-13-01-45-283.png|thumbnail! 

The search box under a project > Issues > All issues > is searching on content
 !image-2021-03-11-13-03-40-833.png|thumbnail! 

The search box under Filters > Advanced issue search is searching based on content/text in issues. 
 !image-2021-03-11-13-04-34-211.png|thumbnail! 
Switching to JQL is showing that the search is by text: 
 !image-2021-03-11-13-05-03-146.png|thumbnail! 

Expected result: when searching under issues in any search box it would be good to have a consistent user experience which will include search on issue key

Business Use Case: for the convenience of searching at speed. When there's five people on a call running a Standup stepping through issues to clarify details, any speed improvement is warranted as people time is the most expensive time.
fields.summary: A consistent search approach in Jira

fields.description: It'd be great if Jira Cloud for Mac registered itself as a browser so I could direct Jira issue links to it from tools like Browser Fairy.
fields.summary: Support linking to an issue in Jira Cloud for Mac

fields.description:
Okay, let me explain.

I support over 8 teams in JIRA. I have to created tickets in many of them and keep thing arranged.

When I am looking at a board (Sprint or Backlog) and I hit the Create Button to create a new issue, it just randomly picks a board and makes a ticket there. Regardless of where I am at and hitting the create button.

What I HOPE would happen is that if I am looking at board X and hit the Create button, it should be safe to assume I want to create a ticket for THE BOARD I AM LOOKING AT, not some random team board that I don't need to create a ticket in.
fields.summary: Creating Issues - When in a board, create should create issues on that board

fields.description:
*Issue* - 

We have a system field named 'Location' present under the custom field section which is supposed to be hidden and is reserved for backend operations however users are able to set context value and add it to the screens.

Adding it to the screen will cause another confusion as the field will not show up on the issue form.

*Steps to replicate* -
 # Go to the custom field section in Jira and search for Location. 
 # Click on three dots and you will see an option "Contexts and default value"
 # Add it to the screen of any test project 
 # Create an issue and you will not see the field.

 

*Actual behavior* -

The field is expected to show up on the issue.

*Expected behaviour* -

It is a system hidden field and should not be available for any modifications or usage like other fields.
fields.summary: Prevent any modification to context for 'Location' field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some [Jira Expressions|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/jira-expressions/], when used on the 'Create' transition in, say, validators or conditions in a workflow are unable to find fields when they are not set.

This is strangely not happening when tickets are created, but affects import of issue via CSV.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use Jira expressions on workflow create transition
 Example:
{code:java}
(issue.customfield_10200 == null || [1,2,3,4,5].includes(issue.customfield_10200){code}

 # Try to import issues via CSV

h3. Expected Results

If the Jira expression returns true, the CSV import operation succeeds and issue is created.
h3. Actual Results

The CSV import operation fails
 Error: Error when transforming object to bean
h3. Workaround

Remove the Jira expression validators in the workflow Create transition to perform the import.
 If Jira expression is used via ScriptRunner, disable the validator and import the issues.
fields.summary: Unable to import issues via CSV if the workflow "Create" transition checks for Jira expressions

fields.description: At the moment, admins don't have an option to see if the users are logged in via web or mobile so they can control access. Request to implement this feature so that admins can monitor user access regularly.
fields.summary: Control access of the users using Jira Cloud for Mobile

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The workflow validator added using the [Jira expressions|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/jira-expressions/] to validate the changes performed on the transition screen always return 'true' value. Eventually, the transition would never fail irrespective of the condition set in the validator.

Use case - For a multi-select custom field, the user should not be able to opt for a new value but could only be able to de-select the existing values.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the Project Setting->Workflow->Validator.
# Use the _Script runner_ app to add the Jira expression as the validator condition.
# Add the condition using the _originalIssue.customfield_XXXXX_ expression.
# e.g _issue.customfield_10149 == null || issue.customfield_10149.every(nv => originalIssue.customfield_10149 != null && originalIssue.customfield_10149.some(ov => ov.value == nv.value))_
!Screenshot 2021-03-10 at 7.22.45 PM.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Expected Results
The validator should fail if the user opts for any new value in the transitions screen.
h3. Actual Results

The user is able to transition irrespective of the validator condition.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira expression unable to validate custom field change on the transaction screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Numbered list in new issue view does not show the line number in Safari until text is added

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using Safari, open a Sprint Board 
# Select a Ticket which gives the modal edit
# Go to the comments and add an ordered (numbered) list.

h3. Expected Results
A "1." appears and then you add more text, and every time you jump line a new consecutive number is automatically added..

h3. Actual Results
Nothing appears until you start writing. The same happens when you jump the line, no number will appear until you start writing. 

h3. Workaround
Using a different web browser than Safari.
fields.summary: Numbered list in new issue view does not show the line number in Safari until text is added

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
As per guide https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/attach-files-and-screenshots-to-issues/ we should have the ability to rename an attached screenhot:
{quote}
*Capture and attach screenshots*

You can capture a screenshot and drop or paste it directly onto an issue.

# Capture a screenshot
# Drop or paste the image onto the issue
# Enter a file name
# Select Upload
{quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
Repeat the steps above in New Issue View

h3. Expected Results
An option to rename the screenshot should appear
h3. Actual Results
Image is attached to issue with default filename created by clipboard

Applying the same steps in the old issue view provides the option to rename the screenshot during the process as per step 3.

h3. Workaround
Rename using Preview or other Capture Software and then Upload the attachment.
fields.summary: Cannot Rename Screenshot when attached

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the new issue view, label type custom fields will suggest labels from the native Labels field. This was not the case in the old issue view where only labels associated that specific custom label field would be suggested.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new custom label field and associate it with a project
 # Then, create a new issue and ensure the new field and the system "Labels" field are populated with a different value. For example , set custom label field = 'Label A' and Labels = 'Label B'
 # Now, create another issue without fill in any value for both field.
 # Then, open the issue using new issue view and edit the field from there.

h3. Expected Results

Label values created in the custom label field should only appear in the suggested labels for that field. Based on the above steps, only 'Label A' should be a suggested value.
h3. Actual Results

Label values from other label fields are available as suggestions even if they were not created using the custom field that is being edited. For example, labels from the native Labels field are present in the suggestions ('Label B') . This is confusing for users and allows a greater chance of users choosing labels they shouldn't be choosing.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Label Type Custom Field Suggestions Are Not Field Scoped in the New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the basic search looking for issues via Issue Key or Issue Number only from the projects' default filters (see it below), the search won't retrieve the respective issues.
 !image-2021-03-09-13-24-39-856.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-03-09-13-24-51-673.png|thumbnail! 

This seem to be happening because Jira is turning the search into {code}Text ~ "####"{code} rather than {code}issuekey = "####"{code}. This can be observed as moving to the advanced search, the JQL is "translated" into text instead.
 !image-2021-03-09-13-25-11-009.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access any classic software project
 # Head to *Issues* from the left menu 
 # Click in one of the default filters like *All Issues*
 # Look for an issue key in the search box

h3. Expected Results
Issue with matching issue key should be found and displayed

h3. Actual Results
Issue with matching issue key is not displayed, because it translates the search into text rather than issue key

h3. Workaround
Use the advanced search and manually type:
{code}
key = "#######"
{code}
fields.summary: Basic search won't find issues by issue key or number from project default filters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Clicking on the 'Reported issues' button doesn't work if you are using Google Chrome.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an issue using Google Chrome
 # Hover over the Reporter field
 # Click on *Reported issues*
 !print.png|width=391,height=177!

h3. Expected Results

The list of issues reported by the user is opened in a new tab or window.
h3. Actual Results

A user dropdown with options to change the Reporter appears.
h3. Notes

The button works correctly on other browsers.
h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: 'Reported issues' button doesn't work on Chrome

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we run multiple concurrent changes for ADF content using Jira REST API, the requests may fail with the following errors:
Response message:
{code}
We couldn't save your changes. Copy your context, then try reloading the page.  
{code}

This typically happens to a PUT in {{/rest/api/3/issue}} but may happen on other operations that update ADF content.

This may be fixed with silent retried to concurrent writes.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

This cannot be consistently reproduced, as this depends on how the system processes the requests and is subject to race conditions. Also, this is a rare occurrence.
# Send two different PUTs updating the same issue

h3. Expected Results

Both of them work.

h3. Actual Results
One of them may fail due to concurrent writes. We see this error in logs:
{code}
Error trying to update issue. Conditional write criteria was not met.
{code}
 

h3. Workaround
On the client side, retry the requests.
fields.summary: Concurrent writes may cause write failures for system fields

fields.description:
When you set an issue key inside a Text Field (single line) Custom field in the Old Issue View, that Issue key automatically inherits a hyperlink to the issue itself. The same doesn't apply to the New Issue View.

*Old Issue View:*
 !image-2021-03-09-10-50-27-077.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-03-09-10-50-49-737.png|thumbnail! 

*New Issue View:*
 !image-2021-03-09-10-52-15-534.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Text Field (single line) Custom fields should display the issues' hyperlink on New Issue View

fields.description:
At the moment, it is only possible to change the status in MS Teams for Jira.

We would like to have the ability for the transition screens to be supported. This becomes useful when we want the users to enter certain fields during transition. For example, let the users choose the value for "Resolution" as compared to having the same value when using post-function.
fields.summary: Support transition screens in MS Teams for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Description:

When searching for a label if the results contain more than 20 matching results, the Labels dropdown sometimes does not show the exact label and asks the user to create a new label of the same name.

This is confusing for instances that have a lot of similar labels as the users believe that the label does not exist. 

Currently, the label dropdown only shows 20 matching results and any other results are not shown to the user. 
h3. How to replicate:
 # Create similar labels for example B-1 to B-23
 # Then create a label B
 # Search for the label B on a new issue
 # The label we are searching for is not shown in the list and UI prompts the user to create a new label with the name B.

 * !Screenshot 2021-03-09 at 10.18.43 AM.png|thumbnail!
 * (Issue Containing all Labels)

 
 * !Screenshot 2021-03-09 at 10.20.20 AM.png|thumbnail!   !Screenshot 2021-03-09 at 10.20.32 AM.png|thumbnail!
 * (Search results when searching for a Label that exists)

h3. Suggestion:

When searching for a Label if a label matches the exact search criteria show it on top before other results.
fields.summary: Labels dropdown does not show labels and prompts user to create a new label if there are more than 20 matching results.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The customer sees his previous comment text while adding a new comment.

1. When a customer tries adding a new comment to an issue, he sees his previous comment text in the new comment box. [attachment1.png]

2. When he removed the previous comment from the new comment box, the view is as attached:  [attachment2.png]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Incognito mode is working fine and is only reproducible in the customer's normal Chrome browser.

h3. Expected Results
The new comment box should not be updated with the previous text.

h3. Actual Results
The customer sees the previous text in the new comment box.

h3. Workaround
Since this is the localStorage issue, and as mitigation, cleaning up the localStorage via Chrome DevTools panel should help. It won't solve the issue for good, but similar to the incognito mode it will remove those existing stored values, so at least there will be fewer IssueView comments affected.
fields.summary: Previous comment text is appearing while adding a new comment

fields.description:
As of now, only the workflow of the subtask can be edited from the parent issue in the new issue view, and there no other edit options.

However, when viewing the issue in the old issue view, there are multiple options (like comment, edit, assign, etc) to edit the subtask from the parent issue itself. 

Having these edit options for subtask from the parent issue in the new issue view will be of added advantage for users.
fields.summary: Subtask in new issue view cannot be edited from the parent issue.

fields.description:
*Issue*
When a comment is set to *Visible to all users* (without any restriction) and saved, the comment cannot be restricted later. 

*Actual behavior*
Comment restrictions cannot be applied to public comments/comments to visible to all users

*Expected behavior* 
Users should have an option to restrict public comments when required
fields.summary: Ability to restrict saved comments

fields.description:
Interface should be more clearer for changing the favicon.

Attempting to change the favicon icon by uploading a file will display the file name. However, the big line with an 'OR' makes it look like "Upload Favicon" button belongs to the lower part only (upload image from a url).
fields.summary: Interface should be more clearer for changing the favicon

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Deleting attachment at "Attachment" section in "New Issue View" causing other attachment that was uploaded the same time failed to load.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create issue via JIRA or Customer Portal. In the create issue screen, attached multiple attachments and add them to the Description field.
 # Then , open issue in JIRA
# Delete one of the attachments at "Attachment" section.
# Load the issue

h3. Expected Results
Only deleted attachment file will not display in the issue.

h3. Actual Results
All existing attachment that was uploaded the same time as the deleted attachment show "Failed to load"

 !Screen Shot 2021-03-08 at 4.05.27 pm.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
* View issue using old issue view , or open from the issue navigator page.
* In the new issue view, edit the description and remove the attachment that was deleted from the panel manually.
fields.summary: Deleting attachment at "Attachment" section in "New Issue View" causing other attachment that was uploaded the same time failed to load

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to search issues using the issue key in the search box since the Status Category is added
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a project
 # Select All issues
 # In the *Search issues* field type a valid issue key  

h3. Expected Results

To return the issue
h3. Actual Results

It returns an error "No issues were found matching your search"
h3. Workaround

No workaround 

Advanced search using JQL 
{code:java}
key in (ABC-179) order by created DESC {code}
fields.summary: Unable to search issues using the issue key in the search box

fields.description:
In the new issue view when you are editing fields like Epic link for example if you hit backspace at the beginning of the field it will exit the edit mode, this can cause text loss if there is a delay and customer hit backspace by error more times than needed, below is the feedback from the customer.
{quote}
Every time I'm editing a series of fields that need updating (for example applying an Epic Link to all issues missing one) the software is extremely unforgiving of mistakes due to the backspace behaviour.

If I make a mistake and press backspace to delete my text then upon hitting backspace one too many times it exits the editing of that field.
This only happens on currently empty fields, if a field already contains a value then you can hit backspace all day long and your cursor will remain in edit more in the field.

On currently empty fields if you make a mistake then habitually (because this is the way it works in all other software and web fields) you will hit backspace more than the necessary number of times to completely clear the field. If you do that in Jira you will have a slight delay and then exit the field. Meaning if you've started typing to replace your mistake then you will set of all the other keyboard shortcuts.

Not only is this problem infuriating from a user experience perspective, it flies in the face of web standards for field behavior.

In the course of editing over 200 hundred tickets today I cannot count the time I've wasted due to this issue.
{quote}
fields.summary: Make optional that the backspace exits the fields edit mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Jira Cloud*. Using *Jira Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-72203].
  {panel}


h3. Issue Summary

When searching JQL using the [WAS operator|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/advanced-search-reference-jql-operators/] it is possible to easily construct a JQL query to see which user made a specific change. 
 For example, if you wanted to know if user jsmith changed the status of an issue to done, you could find these with:
{code:java}
status WAS Done BY jsmith 
{code}
However the problem comes here in Cloud are two fold:
 # Cloud isn't using usernames in the same manner as Server/DC does now. Hence not all Atlassian Account IDs have a true username, but rather an email address and Account ID instead. The Account ID can be used in this WAS operator if you know it. Email address cannot be used here.
 # The other problem here is that the issue navigator in Jira Cloud will not attempt to autocomplete the username or Account ID based on the input here. This feels inconsistent with the behavior that is displayed for assignee or reporter fields. When you search those fields, the issue navigator will attempt to search for users that match that string in some way.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the issue navigator attempt to type out a search such as
{code:java}
status WAS Done BY jsmit
{code}

h3. Expected Results

When typing this out, we would expect that Jira would show you a list of any users that match that string of 'jsmit' so far and let you select one.
h3. Actual Results
 * The Issue Navigator does not offer any possible suggestion based on the input string here.
 * This makes it very difficult for Jira Cloud users to utilize JQL in order to quickly and easily find these issues that were changed by a specific individual.

h3. Workaround

It is possible to instead use the Account ID of the user and use that to query in JQL. However, you have to do some other work first to find this value, which feels overly tedious. You can find this in a few different ways:
 # You could load the user's profile, and then see the Account ID portion in the URL of that page. The URL tends to look something like this [https://********.atlassian.net/people/5bb7ad0ccc53fd07601037802] where '5bb7ad0ccc53fd07601037802' would be the Account ID without quotes.
 # Alternatively, you can run a different JQL query such as
{code:java}
assignee='Full Name' 
{code}
Today Jira Cloud will automatically convert that selected user's name into the Account ID which can then be used in this other query in place of the username value.
fields.summary: JQL search using WAS operator and BY predicates does not auto populate username or Account ID based on string

fields.description:
h3. Summary

By now, text fields values visualization is limited to 40 char. When there is a bigger number, it gets truncated.
h3. Expected Results

When there is enough space on the screen, the full text should be shown.
h3. Actual Results

The field gets truncated: https://share.getcloudapp.com/mXu1vnNw
fields.summary: Text field should show full text in case there is space on the screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Can't use issue id for issue link when importing .csv

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to External System Import and chose .csv
 # Have a .csv mapping issue links with issue ids instead of issue keys
 # Start the import

h3. Expected Results

Links are created correctly

h3. Actual Results

Issues links are not created during the import, and the following error will be shown

{noformat}
2021-03-05 20:44:14,943 INFO - Only new items will be imported
2021-03-05 20:44:15,068 INFO - Importing issue: [externalId='autoid--8904706533663185884', summary='s']
2021-03-05 20:44:15,445 INFO - 1 issues successfully created
2021-03-05 20:44:15,449 INFO - ------------------------------
2021-03-05 20:44:15,449 INFO - Finished Importing : Issues
2021-03-05 20:44:15,449 INFO - ------------------------------
2021-03-05 20:44:15,511 INFO - ------------------------------
2021-03-05 20:44:15,512 INFO - Importing: Issue Links & Subtasks
2021-03-05 20:44:15,512 INFO - ------------------------------
2021-03-05 20:44:15,512 INFO - Only new items will be imported
2021-03-05 20:44:15,518 ERROR - Unable to link issue from autoid--8904706533663185884 to 11857 with link named 'Blocks': Cannot find imported issue key for external id '11857'
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Have your .csv populated with the keys instead of ids
fields.summary: Can't use issue id for issue link when importing .csv

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian, we need more granularity on manage permissions for people that are Administrators (role Administrator) inside a Jira Project or Service Desk Project.
Here the requirement as a Story:

**As* Jira Project Adminstrator*
I want the possibility to:
1. Add existing people to a specific existing group
2. Remove existing people to a specific existing group
3. Edit Properties, Triggers, Conditions, Validators, Post Functions to workflow transitions
4. Edit Issue Types (selecting an existing one)
5. Add workflows to my projects
6. Add Custom Fields to the Default Field Configuration (with approval by the jira-administrators)
7. Use a different issue type schema (selecting only an existing one)
8. Use a different Workflow Scheme (selecting only an existing one)
9. Use a different Screen Schemas (selecting only an existing one)
10.Use a different Field Configuration (selecting only an existing one)
11. Use a different Notification Schema (selecting only an existing one)

*so that *I don't don't need to ask to Jira Administrator help for every single modification on a project that I'm managing. It is time consuming and waste of time.

*Extended project administration* could be improved with these feaures
fields.summary: Extended Permissions for Administrators inside a Jira Project (Delegate permissions)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Where there are more than 100 entries in the Issue history, issue history looks clogged up and it is quite difficult to search for a history item we are looking for. If we can categorize the issue history either by date or add-on type or any kind of filtering, that would be much user friendly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to any issue with the huge issue history.
 # We would be able to notice the Add-on history along with the general issue transitions and in a ticket where the history items are more than 100, there are atleast a 10 screens that user would have to scroll through.

h3. Expected Results

Issue history having filters through which we can decide what data to see while reviewing through it.
h3. Actual Results

Currently, the issue history is listed based on the Ascending date.
fields.summary: Categorise the issue history to avoid confusion among add-on data and issue data

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, due to database constraints, the limit for the URL field is 255 Characters. There is a public document [JIRA throws an error when trying to insert an URL string longer than 255 characters in an URL Custom Field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-throws-an-error-when-trying-to-insert-an-url-string-longer-than-255-characters-in-an-url-custom-field-927239519.html] where the first workaround is to use a *Text Field (multi-line) field type*. 

While testing this workaround, we noticed that the custom field of *multiline text field type*  is not acting as a hyperlink. Whereas while using Description (a system multiline test field), if you input a string starting with 'http://' or 'https://', this field type will recognize as an URL and generate the hyperlink normally.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 1.  Tested with Description - a system field, - *with description.png*

 2. Tested with "multiline custom text field type" - *with custom field.png*


h3. Expected Results
The "multiline custom text field type" should recognize the input string as a URL if inputs with HTTP or HTTPS.

h3. Actual Results
The "multiline custom text field type" recognizes the input string as a normal string even if inputs with HTTP or HTTPS.

h3. Workaround
By default the renderer of the multiline custom filed is "Default Text", please change the renderer to "Wiki type"
fields.summary: Multi line text field not highlighting URL as hyperlink

fields.description: Currently it is possible to request a change of URL on a site, which will redirect the original URL to the new site. For scenarios where sites are merged it would be greatly beneficial be able to request redirecting the URL's to the final merge URL (so the URL of the sites that will not exist anymore will route to the site that is left after the merge).
fields.summary: Provide URL redirection for merging scenarios

fields.description:
The documentation about importing CSV files says:
{quote} # 
 ## *Date format in import file* - Specify the date format used in your CSV file using a syntax that complies with the [Java SimpleDateFormat|http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html].{quote}
However, a small legend in the wizard says despite the selected format in the previous steps:
!image-2021-03-04-18-40-20-181.png|width=600,height=300!

it would be great to show a real example of the expected data, or be clearer in the documentation.
fields.summary: Improve Import CSV documentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to rename the 1st tab in the new issue view it will not update and "General" will remain.

If you change to the old issue view it will display the updated name.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access the screens and rename the first tab to "Test"
 # Go to the issue view and the first tab will continue displaying "General".

h3. Expected Results

The first tab should now be named "Test" like in the old issue view.

h3. Actual Results

The first tab still displays "General" 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Can't rename the 1st tab in new issue view

fields.description:
Unable to filter in Jira for Someone who no longer has access to the application.
I tried to create a Jira filter for a Reporter who is no longer with the company. Jira does not recognize the name.


Expected Behavior
I should be able to search for Jira tickets from past employees. Their accounts may be disabled, but Jira should be able to pick up the data in a field if it exists
fields.summary: We should be able to search JIRA issues based on deleted users

fields.description: Sometimes it's necessary to demo a project before it is completed, so a marker to indicate that something has been demoed in a previous sprint would be helpful to keep track of what work is left.
fields.summary: Option to mark a task/story as 'Demoed'

fields.description: When a task or story isn't fully completed at the end of a sprint, it would be useful to be able to carry that over to the next sprint, but distribute the completed points for each sprint respectively (i.e. if a story has 8 points & 5 are completed in one sprint but the last 3 carry over to the next sprint).
fields.summary: Split estimated points across sprints

fields.description: I have 12 .eml attachments on my issue and if I select download All in the new issue view I get an empty .zip file Attached is a copy of the file produced by Jira. You won't let me log a bug so My Suggestion is Fix this feature.
fields.summary: Download All Attachments on New Issue VIew Generates an Empty zip file

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Clicking on the summary of a child issue and then clicking on the parent without leaving the summary’s edit mode will overwrite the parent’s summary with the child’s summary. 

It happens on both JSW and JSM projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a child issue.
 # Click on the summary.
 # Without clicking outside of the summary, click on the parent on the top of the issue.

h3. Expected Results

It will show the parent normally.
h3. Actual Results

The parent’s summary will be overwritten with the child issue summary.

(Please, check the GIF for a better understanding of the issue)

!Screen Recording 2021-03-04 at 04.53.22 PM.gif|width=517,height=234!
h3. Workaround

Click outside of the summary to exit edit mode and then, click on the parent.
fields.summary: Summary of the Parent issue is overwritten with the summary of the Child issue

fields.description:
Text fields on Android are rendered in white, with dark text. Can this be reversed, like in the Trello mobile app?

Confirmed this happens on an Android 10 device.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud Mobile app - improve text fields display while in dark mode

fields.description:
When comparing to the old issue view, the new issue view does not have "Today" as an option in the date picker for the field "Due Date".

It will be easier for users if the option "Today" is provided for the date picker field.
fields.summary: Date picker for "Due Date" field does not show option "Today"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If there are more than 200 custom issue types added to an issue type scheme, gives an error when we try to add more:
!error_issueTypeScheme.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create over 200 issue types
 # Create an issue type scheme
 # Try to add all of those issue types to the issue type scheme

h3. Expected Results
All issue types were added to the issue type scheme.

h3. Actual Results
An error is displayed preventing us to add those issue types.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Adding around 200 issue types to a custom issue type scheme gives an error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The value changed trigger generates odd behaviour when evaluating smart values on issue creation, whereas on issue updated the behaviour is correct
h3. Steps to Reproduce

The comment part of the rule proves to behave unexpectedly:
 Priority was automatically changed to *Minor*
 Reason: *{{{{fieldChange.field}}}}* was changed from *{{{{fieldChange.fromString}}}}* *->* *{{{{fieldchange.toString}}}}* by {{{{initiator.displayName}}}}
 # When the execution is triggered by the creation of the issue (meaning when the issue is created), the comment added to the issue is malformed, unresolved comment:
 Priority was automatically changed to Minor
 Reason: customfield_14726 was changed from ** ->\ \{self=https://<instance>/rest/api/2/customFieldOption/13113, value=1-Low, id=13113} by <username>
 # When the execution is triggered on the edition of the issue (meaning issue is already existing), the comment added by the execution of the rule works as expected:
 Priority was automatically changed to Minor
 Reason: Scope was changed from 5-High -> 1-Low

h3. Expected Results

The fieldchange smart value to resolve correctly
h3. Actual Results

The fieldchange smart value does not resolve correctly
h3. Workaround

No workaround
 Please refer to [https://codebarrel.atlassian.net/browse/AUT-2136] bug
fields.summary: Automation for Jira FieldChange smart value does not resolve correctly on issue creation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 When the user clicks on back button of the Chrome and tries move from Issue B to issue A having different screen configs, it does not reload the Tabs of the issue and still shows issue B screen config
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # open an issue (issue A) with tabs and linked issues. One of the linked issues should have a different screen config (different tabs)
 # click on a linked issue (issue B) with different tabs config. It should load fine.
 # click on back button or navigate some other way back to issue A (eg via breadcrumbs in case of task->subtask transition)

h3. Expected Results

Layout and tabs should render properly.
h3. Actual Results

Tabs aren't updated (it shows tabs of issue B)
h3. Workaround

Opening the issue in separate window or new Tab of the browser helps.
fields.summary: Tabs don't re-render on issue transition

fields.description: It is possible to see a list of users for the *Reporter* or *Assignee* fields, but multiple option picker fields (e.g., *Approvers*) don't populate until a letter a character is typed out and only show matching results.
fields.summary: Ability to see list of options in multiple option picker fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It was previously possible to add a link to the body of the [Rich Text Gadget|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1214632/rich-text-gadget-for-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] to a Confluence page. When clicked, the page would load inside the gadget. With the recent introduction of updates to the dashboard and gadget UI, this is no longer possible. Clicking the link within the gadget causes the gadget to refresh and no content is displayed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the [Rich Text Gadget|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1214632/rich-text-gadget-for-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=overview]
 # Create a new dashboard in Jira
 # Add the Rich Text Gadget to the dashboard
 # Add some text to the body of the gadget and then create link with that text that points to a Confluence page within your site.

h3. Expected Results

When clicked, the page loads inside the gadget.
h3. Actual Results

When clicked, the gadget refreshes but the Confluence page content is not displayed.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Rich Text Gadget Fails to Load Embedded Confluence Page

fields.description:
Currently, when clicking links in a Jira issue, it automatically redirects users within the same window.

This is extremely frustrating when attempting to view assets, documents or issues linked in descriptions as you are completely removed from the issue itself.

It would make much more sense to simply pop open a new browser window to maintain accessibility to both the existing issue and whatever is being linked out too.
fields.summary: When clicking links within a JIRA issue, open a new browser tab

fields.description:
Currently, the issue view displays about 20 characters in multi-select custom fields.

With the current limit, it's necessary to edit the field to be able to see the full values.

 !Screen Shot 2021-03-03 at 1.26.58 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2021-03-03 at 1.27.12 PM.png|thumbnail! 

As a Jira administrator, I want to be able to edit the number of characters shown in a custom multi-select field to make it easier to read the value selected.
fields.summary: As a Jira admin, I want to be able to edit the number of characters shown in a custom multi-select field

fields.description:
During the move of a subtask to a different parent issue in the same project, when the destination parent issue is entered in lower case, it shows the error - "issue does not exist". 
However, this works when the issue key is entered in capital letters.

The error should be more precise and should inform users about the case sensitivity.
fields.summary: Moving a subtask to a different parent issue shows incorrect error.

fields.description:
As vezes a equipe ao invés de fazer o download do arquivo anexo acaba excluindo o arquivo pela facilidade e proximidade dos ícones. Seria possível ao clicar em excluir o anexo criar uma mensagem do tipo: "Você tem certeza que deseja excluir esse anexo?" Sim ou Não.
Acho diminuiríamos chances de falhas, conseguem me ajudar?
fields.summary: Criar um pop-up antes de deletar um anexo.

fields.description:
Would it be possible to implement a similar feature that exists in the old issue view to autosave the "Description"? 

The new issue view does not explicitly save your content unless you attempt to save it (enter or click save). Whereas in the old issue view the draft would be autosaved once you navigate away from the description field.
!Screenshot 2021-03-03 at 3.50.08 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Auto-saving the Description in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creatingan  issue using the 'Create Issue in Epic' button, Jira emits extra webhook events for issue link creation.

Developer community thread: https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/duplicated-issuelink-events-when-creating-issues-in-epic/45670

In particular we emit:
* issuelink_created (id 1)
* issuelink_deleted (id 1)
* issuelink_created (id 2)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 Navigate to Epic
Create issue using 'Create Issue in Epic' button

h3. Expected Results

Single webhook event for issuelink_created

h3. Actual Results

Three webhook events, 1 for creating an issue link, one for deleting that issue link and a final event for creating the final issuelink.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Creating an issue using the 'Create Issue in Epic' button causes surplus webhook events

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Depending on the locale/language you have set in your Atlassian Account profile, dates and times in Jira can display in either a "normal" way or a "verbose" way.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

 # Browsing to <your Cloud site>/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa, your profile says that your language is {{en}} instead of {{English (United Kingdom)}} or similar.
 # Browse to an issue

h3. Expected Results

The dates on comments and in the date section should display in the format e.g. {{February 1, 2021, 6:32 PM}}

h3. Actual Results

 !image-2021-03-03-10-13-57-600.png|thumbnail! 

Dates render in the format e.g. {{Mon Dec 14 2020 14:33:22 GMT+1100 (Australian Eastern Daylight Time)}}.

There is an error in the browser console:
{noformat}
Non supported locale in tenant context: en
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

# Navigate to https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences
# Change your language to one of the options in the list. It will appear that you already have English selected, so you may need to change it to something else, then back to your intended language.
# Wait until these changes make their way to Jira (should be up to a minute?)
fields.summary: Date times in Jira display in a verbose format

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Whenever a user tries to do a historical search for next-gen issues with a specific status/type/resolution, JQL returns incorrect results. 

status was "Done" -> won't return any next-gen issues
 status was not "Done" -> will return all next-gen issues
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Consider a Next-gen project
 # Try use historical search keywords like (WAS, WAS NOT IN, CHANGED ) in the JQL
 # JQL will either show all or none next-gen tickets (depending on whether NOT was used) instead of filtering as per the Historical search.

h3. Expected Results

Should give the list of issues in the specific status during the mentioned time period.
h3. Actual Results

JQL results either all or none next-gen tickets (depending on whether NOT was used)
h3. Workaround

Next-gen projects define a custom schema for entities like status, type or resolution. Historical JQL searches don't support it. As a result for next-gen, it is required to pass entity id instead of name.

To find the id of a specific status/type/resolution, check its value on one of issues using [GET rest/api/2/issue endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issues/#api-rest-api-3-issue-issueidorkey-get]. Then use it in JQL:  status was IN (10002)
fields.summary: Historical search does not retrieve the correct results with Next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the Rest API endpoint https://YOUR_INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/role, all issue types with the scope information are used on Next-Gen projects.

Once you move that Next-gen project to the trash, all the project-related roles from that project are shown without the scope under them. This creates bias information, where the customer could get duplicated roles without knowing which one is from Classic projects.



h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Move this Next-gen project to the trash
 # Run this endpoint - https://YOUR_INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/role
 # Roles will be shown without any scope

h3. Expected Results
You should not fetch the roles from the Next-gen project that is in the trash.

h3. Actual Results
You are able to fetch the project roles without any scope.


h3. Workaround
Remove the Nextgen Project from the Trash.
fields.summary: Rest API shows Project Roles without scope for Next-gen projects moved to trash

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Once you set a value for a Text Field single-line (custom field) and then clear that value, Jira's JQL will not recognize that field as EMPTY anymore.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue with a custom field (single-line text field)
 # remove the custom field value later
 # Make a JQL search:
{quote}"singleLineTextFielsName" ~ "fieldvalue"
{quote}

h3. Expected Results

The field should be considered as empty again since no information is set.
h3. Actual Results

JQL still shows the issue where the field is no more set.
 Rest API shows correct data.

h3. Workaround

As a workaround, you can exclude these issues by adding {{AND custom_field IS NOT EMPTY}} to your JQL search.

You can also allow Automation for Jira to properly clear this field for you by running an automation that updates this field to a "NULL" value. You can [+import+|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/import-and-export-automation-rules/] this rule and apply it to your own text field: [^automation-rule-2616645-202111011333.json]
fields.summary: JQL for Single-line Text Field finds issue by value even when that field was cleared

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding an issue link to a ticket, the 'Server' pop-up shows the servers in an arbitrary order. This should be predictable; alphabetical would be ideal.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click 'Link issue' from an issue
 # Pop up the 'Local' menu to show other linked servers

h3. Expected Results

Servers are listed in alphabetical order, with this instance first.
h3. Actual Results

Order is based on the order the application links were added, from the underlying Application Links framework.
h3. Workaround

Type the server's name to locate it quickly.
fields.summary: Issue links should show Servers in predictable order

fields.description: When you have different fields on the task and story issue types, and want to change the issue type, a straight issue type change would mean potentially losing some data. This means you have to go through the bulk move process to specifically map field by field, which is cumbersome and I would like for it to be more user-friendly.
fields.summary: Improve the Move Issue process experience

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Multi-line text fields do not respect the "hide when empty" agent view configuration if there was a value added to it that was removed

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # have a multi-line text field on the "hide when empty" section of the Agent view
 # Create a new ticket with no value to it
 # *The field will be hidden*
 # Add a value to it, the field will be shown
 # Remove that value

h3. Expected Results
The field is hidden again

h3. Actual Results
The field is now always shown

.gif demonstrating it: https://share.getcloudapp.com/Qwu95m0l

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Multi-line text fields do not respect the "hide when empty" agent view configuration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Having at least 2 release versions, in two JSM projects, and configuring then to display on a Jira Road Map gadget. It throws the following error when accessing the version from the gadget:

"Permission Violation

It seems that you have tried to perform an operation which you are not permitted to perform.

If you think this message is wrong, null."

The URL that returns the error is https://<instance>.atlassian.net/browse/<projectkey>/fixforversion/<versionID>
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have 2 JSM projects
 # Have at least 1 version on each JSM project with a specified *Release date*
 # Create a Jira Road Map gadget and make sure both versions from the two different projects are displayed
 # Try to access both versions through the gadget

 !Gadget.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

You're redirected to the URL https://<instance>.atlassian.net/browse/<projectkey>/fixforversion/<versionID> for both cases and is able to view both versions' information.
h3. Actual Results

You're redirected to URL https://<instance>.atlassian.net/browse/<projectkey>/fixforversion/<versionID>, and one version is displayed as expected but the other will return the *Permission Violation* error.

If you have more than two JSM projects displaying information on this gadget, then it shall only work for one project and it will fail for the others.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior.

However, it's possible to see the information of the version by accessing the project > *Project settings* > *Versions*, then going on the gadget and clicking on the version there.

!Gadget.png|thumbnail!

With this, the project you just accessed will work on the gadget, but the others will fail.

You can do that to each project, just to view the information if required.
fields.summary: Permission Violation error on Jira Road Map gadget for JSM projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Having two double dashes inside a code block in a Jira comment (-- foo --) will cause two of those dashes to be converted to ~, because being enclosed by double-dashes in Jira and tildes in Slack mean strikethrough formatting. However, since it's inside a code block, it should not trigger such formatting.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a link or a comment in Jira using "-".
 # When viewing the same link or comment in Slack dashes will be converted to "~".

h3. Expected Results

The format of the dashes should not change to another character. 

h3. Actual Results

Dashes "-" are converted to "~"

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Double dashes inside code blocks in Jira comments are converted to tilde in Slack notifications

fields.description:
When changes are made in the configuration for Slack integrations with Jira a notification about them is sent to the configured channel and they are visible to all members.

Admins would benefit from the ability to control which actions are notified to the users.
fields.summary: Slack integration ability to disable configuration change notifications

fields.description: In Jira next-gen, it would be immensely valuable to be able to toggle viewing the epic assignee picture as part of the roadmap view.
fields.summary: View assignee for Epics in Roadmap view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When comparing the issue field {*}Request Type{*}, the initial results in the dropdown show the last 50 *Request Types* updated, but when you start to type to execute a search, the results don't bring {*}hidden Request Types{*}.
h3. Suggested Solution

Show *Hidden Request Types* in search results.
h3. Why this is important

When the user has more than 50 {*}Request Types{*}, it is impossible to use the Issue fields conditions since there is a chance of the *hidden Request Types* won't appear in the initial results. The only solution is to use the workarounds below, which may be more complex for some users than others, depending on their actual scenario.
h3. Workarounds
 - Temporarily unhide the Request Type to add it to the condition.
 - Create an Automation from Global scope

 - Use the *JQL condition* querying the {*}Request Type{*}:
{noformat}
"Request Type" in ("Request Type Name"){noformat}

 - Use the {*}Advanced compare condition{*}, using the first value as
{noformat}
{{issue.Request Type.requestType.name}}{noformat}
fields.summary: Show hidden Request Types in Issue fields conditions

fields.description:
*Summary:*

A post-function is configured on a transition to create subtask via scriptrunner/JMWE/Automation:

1. Issue is transitioned from Status1 to Status2
 2. Subtasks are created (in the background) or field is updated in the background
 3. The page should display the created subtask/updated field instantly on the same page.

 

*Expected result:*

It would be nice to have post-functions run within the process so that the changes get reflected immediately on the Jira issue without refreshing the page.

*Actual Result:*

Refreshing the page loads the subtask(s)/field(s) on Jira issue
fields.summary: Jira should automatically refresh the issue after an issue updated/actioned via postfunction

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The sprint field should be a hyperlink to the relative sprint.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a ticket
 # Check sprint field it is a text field 

h3. Expected Results

The sprint field should be a hyperlink to the relative sprint.
h3. Actual Results

The sprint field is just a text field
h3. Workaround

No workaround available
fields.summary: The sprint field should be a hyperlink to the relative sprint not a text field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the "Z" key in the advanced search list view to moving between pages, the changes are reflected immediately in the old issue view but not in the new issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Do an advance search in list view in the old issue view
 # Use the shortcut key "Z" to move to the issue page
 # Make a change in the issue and go back to the advanced search using the "Z" shortcut
 # The change will be reflected automatically
 # Do the same with the new issue view activared and the update will only be reflected until you do a refresh

Video example:
https://share.getcloudapp.com/6quQbnXg

h3. Expected Results
The updates should be reflected immediately when returning to the advanced search page
like in the old issue view

h3. Actual Results
The changes are reflected until you do the search again

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When using the "Z" key shortcut in the advanced search list view to moving between pages, the changes are reflected immediately in the old issue view but not in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
We are not able to attach large files (135mb or more) using the old issue view in issues that have already been created.

Note: Generate the large file in zsh:
{code}dd if=/dev/zero of=135mbtestfile.dat  bs=1m  count=135{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Be in a JSM project;
- Find an already created issue;
- Be using old issue view;
- Attach a large file (135mb+?) to the issue. You can either use the _Drop files to attach, or browse_ or attach in the comment itself.

Screenshot:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
File is attached to the issue

h3. Actual Results
File fails to be attached.
The attachment XHR request to /rest/internal/2/AttachTemporaryFile ends up in a 401 unauthorized error.

h3. Workaround

Use the new issue view to attach the large files.
fields.summary: Not able to attach large files to already existing issues using the old issue view

fields.description:
We have several templates that we've created in the old Markup format. We use these templates every week with new batches of tickets and when creating individual tickets. I was able to make these templates with the old format view option, but now that's gone away and if I want to make changes I have to guess and edit these in a spreadsheet. Less than ideal. 

The Markup format is still the standard for Batch Importing tickets as well. 99% of our tickets are made through batch import. So a few questions/comments:
 # Will Markup remain the standard for Batch importing?
 # Will Markup remain the standard for creating new issues?
 # Can I get support to edit these templates in the old view like we had before. 

Below is an example of our template that most tickets have. We import with batch importer and copy this into new tickets. 

{color:#172B4D}*------- Concept Art -------*\{color}
[Concept Art Here]

{color:#172B4D}*------- Ortho Art -------*\{color}
[Ortho Art Here]

{color:#d04437}*-------Description of the Asset -------*\{color}
*Overview:* 
*Script Link:*
{color:#008DA6}*-------Notes for Departments -------*\{color}
*2D:*
*3D:*
*Animation:*
*Content:*
{color:#f691b2}*------- Export and p4 Data -------*\{color}
*Concept Art p4 Link*

*Ortho Art p4 Link*

*Maya file p4 link*
.
*Model Skin Name*
_[modelname_skin]_

*\{color:#FF8B00}------- Rig Template -------\{color}*
(If applicable)
*\{color:#00875A}------- Rendered Icons -------\{color}*
(Only applicable to event items)
fields.summary: Markup support for New Jira Issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The new "Issue detail view" does not open the dialog box when creating a sub-task
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set a required field in a Jira project
 # Navigate to the appropriate board
 # Select an issue and hit to create a sub-task, it will create as inline create issue
 # Create more than one sub-task

h3. Expected Results
 * Should open dialog box instead of the inline create issue

h3. Actual Results
 * The second sub-task isn't created and it shows an error message

Note: users may create one sub-task but it fails to create the second one.
h3. Workaround
 * Navigate to your profile(https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa) and disable "Issue detail view"; this is a per-user setting(each end user will need to make this change themselves)
 * To create a subsequent subtask, use *Create another* option in the first subtask issue creation screen whenever feasible or the parent task needs to be refreshed.
fields.summary: In the new issue view, create sub-task does not open dialog box

fields.description:
Use case -

When Bitbucket and Jira are integrated and the repositories are synced under the Code section of Jira projects, the automation rule currently will not recognize a pull request if it is without an issue key.

Any possible way under automation rules to determine a PR activity (without specifying issue key) in the repositories would help.
fields.summary: Automation rules should recognise the pull requests generated for the repositories in the Code section even when there is no issue key in the PR

fields.description:
Currently, the smart link on the new issue view is including the issue summary as well and it sometimes confuses the comment.

So, it would be awesome to have that feature as it is on the old issue view, only *issuekey+status*.

Also, if there are many smart links sometimes it doesn't load properly or doesn't convert the reference to a smart link.
fields.summary: Improve smart links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Error deleting attachment with property "jira.issue.editable" set to False in the workflow step e.g. DONE or CLOSED in new issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set "jira.issue.editable" to DONE/CLOSED step in the workflow
 # Create an issue with attachments
 # Transition the issue to DONE/CLOSED
 # Try to delete the attachments.

h3. Expected Results
The delete button shouldn't be accessible or the error thrown should mention about the issue is not editable.

h3. Actual Results
Error thrown is about connection issue:
 !attachment_delete.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Remove "jira.issue.editable" property in the workflow or if possible, move the issue to a different status first before deleting the attachments.
(I) It is expected behaviour for the property to block attachments to be deleted as that is part of editing an issue.
fields.summary: Error deleting attachment with property jira.issue.editable set to False

fields.description:
Comment links opens do not open in a new window.

If I create a link in the comments, task description or any other place that has this insertion, the same instead of opening a new window, redirects the user in the current screen.

I believe that a simple "target = _blank" would do the trick.
fields.summary: Comment links open does not open in a new window

fields.description:
Trying to delete an issue type requires not having any issue with that issue type first, whether deleting the issues or changing the issue type.

If a project is moved to the Trash, the issues in it can still block deleting an issue type, and even though the message will indicate that there are X number of issues pending, trying to see which issues are those will not show them in the issue search, as the issues in the trash are not shown in the search.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

The suggestion is to improve the visibility of issues in the trash or to include mentions in the messages that indicate this behavior.
fields.summary: Trying to delete an issue type with an issue of that issue type in the trash causes confusion

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The [performance insights|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/view-performance-insights/] is a very powerful feature for admins to get insights on their usage of rules.

It is particularly useful for avoiding hitting the [+service limits+|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/what-are-service-limits/] in place and monitors rules are throttled, loop, some errors, no actions and success.

However, the problem with this overview is that it is limited to only display the top 20 rules of the given date range which heavily limits the potential of the feature.

 !Automation_rules_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion

To allow users to troubleshoot on a more granular level for specific rules that may not fall in the top 20, the *Showing top 20 rules* should be expandable to increase the number of rules displayed. Alternatively, a search option to look for a specific rule can also be implemented.
fields.summary: Increase the performance insights rule range

fields.description:
As of now, the Jira issue view renders tabs sorted by id in ascending order, however users are able to change the order on Configure Screen page.

Expected result:
The tabs should render in layout config in the same order as they are on Configure Screen
fields.summary: Tabs should keep order as on Configure Screen page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This bug is issue view only. We don’t have sorting working in layout config as well, but there is a separate ticket for this.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# go to screen config page and create several tabs, add fields inside
# go to the layout config page and shuffle fields around, save layout config
# go to screen config page and move tabs around
# go to issue view to see if the order of tabs was changed accordingly

h3. Expected Results

The order of tabs in the issue view is the same as in the screen config

h3. Actual Results

The order of tabs in the issue view is the same as it was at the moment of saving layout config (step 2)

h3. Workaround

Disable the new issue view for the now. To disable the new issue view, please follow the steps described below:

# Go to Jira home page and click on the avatar at the bottom-left of the screen and then click on *Personal settings*
# Under *Jira labs*, next to *New Jira issue view for software projects*, disable this feature by clicking on the green button (it will become gray and a feedback pop-up will appear)
fields.summary: Order of tabs isn't respected in issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If Service desk project filter contains + icon in status doesn’t show results in MS teams

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Create a status with "+" icon (ex: "I+D:PENDING") in workflow 
 !image-2021-02-25-18-18-42-350.png|thumbnail! 
 # Step 2 Create issue and set the status "I+D:PENDING"
 # Step 3 Create a filter ex: {project = "Demo service desk" AND status IN ("Open","i+d:Pending")}
 !image-2021-02-25-18-20-25-561.png|thumbnail! 
# Step 4 Go to MS teams and create a tab for JIRA cloud and select filter 
 !image-2021-02-25-18-21-53-938.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Jira filter should show results in MS teams tab.

h3. Actual Results
Jira filter doesn’t show results in MS teams tab.
 !image-2021-02-25-18-22-56-866.png|thumbnail! 

Note: It works in software project filter
h3. Workaround

Remove the "+" icon from the status.
fields.summary: Service desk project filter contains + in status doesn’t show results in MS teams

fields.description: It would be great if we can display user's job title while assigning issues to the user. We can leverage the 'Job title' present in user's _Profile and visibility_ section.
fields.summary: Display 'Job title' in Jira while picking users in 'Assignee' section, along with their display names.

fields.description:
*Concern* - 

Currently, the *Issue Description* that contains links or any URLs will not show up fine in the *Issue History*. The text overlaps which makes it very difficult to understand.

*Current behavior* -

As shown in the screenshot, the text overlaps

*Expected behavior -* 

The text should not overlap

*Workaround -*

None
fields.summary: Issue history shows description text overlapped and is not readable

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After clicking on the issue collector link added to a page, if you press the ESC key before the form loads, the loading icon (the spinning wheel) does not close and keeps on spinning forever:

!Issue-Collector-ESC.jpg|width=226,height=91!  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the issue collector to a page by following the instructions in [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/use-the-issue-collector/] (or just click on the "Provide feedback about this article" link at the bottom of the page)
 # Press ESC before the Issue Collector form is displayed

h3. Expected Results

The loading icon is closed
h3. Actual Results

The loading icon keeps on spinning on the top of the page. See below gif for details:

!issue-collector-esc-key-issue.gif|width=247,height=176!
h3. Workaround

Refresh the page
fields.summary: Closing the issue collector using the ESC key leaves the loading icon spinning forever

fields.description:
Previously it was possible to directly use the link to a CSV export after generating it for the first time in the form of 
https://<site name>.atlassian.net/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-csv-all-fields/<search request ID>/SearchRequest-<search request ID>.csv?tempMax=1000

This would export all the issues related to that search request, up to the date it was being called. Now there seems to have been a change which blocks using this link and a screen is shown:   !image-2021-02-25-16-35-39-360.png|thumbnail! 

Having a direct link is really useful to optimize operation instead of having to go to the filter and export manually every time we want to generate the report so the request is to have this link working again.
fields.summary: Allow using direct links for CSV Export

fields.description:
h3. Problem
From a Trello Card, using the Power-Ups app if we create a Jira issue, Jira Issue gets created but there is no link to the Trello Card.

h3. Suggested Solution
_Add a hyperlink from Jira Issue to Trello Card_

h3. Why This Is Important
_Currently we can't navigate to Trello Card from Jira Issue. Once the Jira issue gets created, the issue label is updated with the Trello Card ID. If we have a hyperlink that will connect Jira Issue (created from Power-Ups Trello app) with the source Trello Card, it will become more user-friendly. 

h3. Workaround
_Currently no Workaround. We can't get to the Trello card with the ID, need to get in touch with Treelo Support_
fields.summary: Missing Trello Card link from Jira Issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Jira next-gen projects, if a child issue of an Epic is cloned, then the newly created clone issue is not linked to parent Epic.

In Jira classic projects, the parent Epic of the source issue is linked in the cloned issue as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1) Create a Jira next-gen project
2) Create an Epic issue
3) Create a child issue under the Epic created in Step 2
4) Clone the child issue created in step 3.

h3. Expected Results
The parent Epic of the source issue will be linked to the cloned issue.

h3. Actual Results
The cloned issue does not have a parent Epic linked

h3. Workaround
Manually link the parent Epic to the cloned issue
fields.summary: Cloning a child issue under an Epic in next-gen projects does not link the parent Epic to the cloned issue

fields.description: It should behave just like the "Create" button just autopopulate the Epic Link.
fields.summary: Create Issue in Epic should allow you to select in which Project you want to create the issue in

fields.description: When we use you create linked issue functionality it takes us to a generic create issue form. we need this to either use the defined "Create" issue page for the project/Issue type or we need the ability to Hide the quick-add buttons so our users do not create issues using the linked issue creation form your rendering. Using the limited form you render for all issues breaks several of our workflows and automations.
fields.summary: New issue view critical feature missing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
"Field has been Modified" Validator does not work on Priority field from any transition
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the validator  "Field has been Modified" using the Priority field

h3. Expected Results
Before transitioning the issue it should request a change to the Priority field
h3. Actual Results
It allows you to transition without making changes to the Priority field

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Field has been Modified" Validator does not work on Priority field from any transition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If there are multiple attachments added on a comment, and if one of those attachments is deleted from the Old Issue view, then all attachments in that comment Fail to load. Any attachments in other comments are not affected.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a comment with 3 attachments
 # Switch to the Old Issue view and delete one of those attachments from the attachment section.
 # Switch back to the New Issue view, you can see the attachment fails to load.

Recording of this behavior: [^Screen Recording 2021-02-24 at 9.46.17 PM.mov]
h3. Expected Results

The attachment loads fine even after switching to the New Issue view
h3. Actual Results

Attachments fail to load.

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
"code": "JwtAuthoriser:AuthorisationError",
    "title": "The token does not allow requested operation. \"urn:filestore:file:<>c\" needs \"read\" permission",
    "href": "https://api.media.atlassian.com#UnauthorizedError"
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Deleting the attachments from Old Issue view, fails to load the attachment in the new Issue view.

fields.description:
As of now User management page under settings in JS shows Last seen for users when logged in through Jira software system only. A user can create issues in JS through JSM or API, which is not considered under User Management Page, "last seen" under Jira Software Product as shown in the snapshot.
This causes difficulty for customers who wants to perform access review to close access to users that didn't connect over the last 90 days or so.

Please have User management page track logins from other products when users access Jira software Customers then need not contact support for Audit information.
fields.summary: Need to track User's last login from other products when using Jira software

fields.description:
The search field for assignee in the create issue form doesn't recognise the character é as e. 

But the field on an issue does.

I have screenshots.

 

We have a colleague with the name Corné, When I search for Corne in the create issue form it doesn't come up with Corné, When searching for Corn is does pop up.

 

But when I search for Corne in the issue itself, it does come up with Corné. Even when i am searching with the e instead of the é.
fields.summary: Search fields not working the same way. Not recognising special character

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Logged-in user does not have project permissions when access is set to Group - Public

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the *Browse Projects* permission to _Group - Public_. The description says _Any logged in or anonymous user can browse this project._ See screenshot below
 !2021-02-24_11-41-15.png|thumbnail!
 # Access the project's issues as a logged in user without JSW and JSM access.

h3. Expected Results
 * Logged in user should be able to access the issue, providing the issue does not have any issue security set.

h3. Actual Results
 * The logged in user is not allowed access the project issues

h3. Workaround
 * Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Logged-in user does not have project permissions when access is set to Group - Public

fields.description:
There are many Users similar to me, that feel the new view is inefficient and takes up too much real estate on the screen requiring more scrolling, slide bars, etc. The old view gives us what we need in a format we want it.

We should be able to KEEP the old view *indefinitely* even if it is a setting our Admins need to make.  I'm sorry to say but I hate the new view.
fields.summary: Keep the Old Issue View Indefinitely

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
JQL search using a custom field short text does not behave consistently. It sometimes returns the matching field

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field of short text type
# Populate some issues with random values
# Use JQL Advanced Search using the custom field

h3. Expected Results
Whenever you search, it should return all the matching cases

h3. Actual Results
Some cases, randomly, are not returned by the search

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior using the custom field. But, it is possible to use the text ~ "" to get the results.
fields.summary: JQL search using a custom field short text does not behave consistently

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Filter permission page times out while loading
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Open a JSW board settings (general)
 * Click on "Edit Filter Shares"

OR
 * Open the filter
 * Click on "Details"
 * Open "Edit Permissions" in a new tab

h3. Expected Results

Page loads
h3. Actual Results

Page times out
h3. Workaround
 * Open a JSW board settings (general)
 * Click on "Edit Filter Query"
 * Click on "Details" and then "Edit Permissions"

OR
 * Open the filter (https://<site name>.atlassian.net/issues/?filter=<filter id>)
 * Click on "Edit Filter Query"
 * Click on "Details" and then "Edit Permissions"
fields.summary: Filter permission page times out while loading

fields.description:
h4. Summary

At this moment, when you click on the custom field User Picker, to select a user, it will show "*No option*" as a result. Even if we have a list of users.
 * [*Video*|https://share.getcloudapp.com/YEuXkRxK]  showing the behavior.

h4. Suggestion
 * Maybe we can copy the behavior of the assignee field to the User Picker.
 * Load the recently utilized user might be useful.

h4. Workaround
If we try to search by the user name it will appear.
fields.summary: User Picker custom field could show the recently utilized user instead of "No option"

fields.description:
*Issue* - 

Comment visibility restrictions cannot be set when an issue is opened on the board however when we load the issue in full view then we do see the options.

Screenshots of the behavior attached.

*Actual behavior* -

Double click on an issue on a board and in the comment box, click on the lock icon. A message will pop up that says it is visible to all.

fields.description:
When using an automation to edit an issue, all fields are shown except for the "Restrict' field, which allows restricting issues to specific roles in Next-gen projects. Having this available in automation would allow more flexibility for Next-gen issues.

 !image-2021-02-23-15-22-16-398.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-02-23-15-23-03-172.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-02-23-15-24-28-607.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow Automation to edit the Restriction level on Next-gen Issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Trashed custom fields will get restored with Jira site import.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Move some custom fields to Trash
# Create XML backup for Jira
# Perform a site import to another Jira instance
# Check the trashed custom fields in the newly imported Jira

h3. Expected behaviour
Custom fields stay in trash.

h3. Current behaviour
Custom fields no longer in trash.

h3. Workaround
No available workaround other than moving the custom fields to trash again.
fields.summary: Jira site import restore trashed custom fields

fields.description:
h3. Problem
In Next Gen moving the Tasks and its subtasks to Epic in another project causes error 500 and corrupted data

h3. Environment
Next Gen

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create a Task with a few Subtask in Project A
Move the ticket to the project B by 
Mapping Task ----> Epic
Mapping Subtask -----> Subtask
Follow the prompts
Confirm
Refresh
Acknowledge
Error 500 please see the attache screenshots
The subtasks are not showing in the Epic but there is a broken link between the Epic and subtasks
Deleting the Epic will delete all the subtasks also.

h3. Expected Results
Either give a warning this mapping is not supported or keep the hierarchy as it is expected

h3. Actual Results
Corrupted data

h3. Workaround
To clone the Epic as a Task and move the subtasks to the Task
fields.summary: In Next Gen moving the Tasks and its subtasks to Epic  in another project causes error 500 and corrupted data
